name: Cathead Biscuits
author: Hollinhead77
summary: This is the old-time recipe from our grandmamas. There is no real measurement in this for the shortening. Wonderful and tasty heavy biscuit from the old times. Great with homemade sausage gravy. Always always always use White Lily® flour for the fluffiest biscuits. I usually don't always use all of the buttermilk. I seem to usually have just under a 1/4 cup leftover.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons room-temperature vegetable shortening (such as Crisco®), or as needed
1 ¾ cups buttermilk, or as needed
¼ cup melted butter for brushing, or to taste
directions: Preheat an oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C)
Sift flour and salt together into a large mixing bowl
Make a dent in flour by pushing flour from center toward sides of bowl
Add 2 walnut-size lumps of shortening and a splash of buttermilk to the flour where you made the dent
Work the shortening into the flour using fingers in a twisting motion (rub thumb against pointer and middle finger motion) until the shortening is fully incorporated into the flour
Pour buttermilk into the flour about 1/4 cup at a time, continuing to work it in with your fingers until the buttermilk is completely incorporated into a sticky dough
Roll dough into 8 large balls and drop into prepared cake pan, working around the outside and putting the last one in middle to fill the pan
Press dough balls with back of fingers to flatten until they touch and are about 3/4- to 1-inch thick
Bake in preheated oven until the tops are golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes
